page.title: 12HANSLOPE PARK
page.content: HANSLOPE PARK IS A PART OF THE FOREIGN AND COMMONWEALTH OFFICE.IT SENDS AND RECEIVES MESSAGES TO AND FROM THE EMBASSIES IN EVERY COUNTRY IN THE WORLD EXCEPT ALBANIA.IT HAS ABOUT FORTY AERIALS WHICH TRANSMIT THE MESSAGES.THE PARK HAS A FIBRE-GLASS STRUCTURE OUTSIDE WHICH CAN TRANSMIT MESSAGES IN THE RAIN.BECAUSE IT IS MADE OF FIBRE-GLASS,THE RADIO AND SOUND WAVES JUST PASS THROUGH IT AS THOUGH IT DIDN'T EXIST.TELEX MESSAGES ARE ALSO TRANSMITTED FROM HANSLOPE PARK.YOU TYPE IN YOUR MESSAGE AND IT PRINTS OUT ON THE SCREEN AT THE OTHER END OF THE TRANSMISSION.THE PARK HAS ONE HELICOPTER WHICH TRANSPORTS DIPLOMATS ABROAD.THEY SOMETIMES TAKE SPECIAL BAGS WITH THEM WITH DOCUMENTS INSIDE THEM. THE PARK ALSO USE TELEPHONES TO COMMUNICATE WITH OTHER COUNTRIES. BY J SULLIVAN
